lines.content: Hey there! üëã Meet Doraemon - your super cute and friendly schedule assistant! ‚ú® Built with JavaFX, this little blue robot cat is here to help you stay organized and never miss a deadline! üéØ
- ‚úÖ **Task Management**: Add, delete, mark, and unmark tasks like a pro!
- üìù **Multiple Task Types**: Todo, Deadline, and Event tasks - we've got you covered!
- üîç **Smart Search**: Find your tasks super quickly with keyword search and Retrieve tasks with certain priority!
- üé® **Beautiful GUI**: Gorgeous gradient backgrounds and smooth animations that'll make you smile üòä
- üíæ **Auto-Save**: Your tasks are automatically saved - no worries about losing anything!
2. üíª Open it up in IntelliJ IDEA
That's it! You're ready to go! üéâ
- **`hi`** ü•≥ - See all possible commands and features
- **`list`** üìã - See all your tasks at once!
- **`event <description> / <start> / <end> [priority]`** üìÖ - Add an event with start and end dates
- **`mark <index>`** ‚úÖ - Mark a task as done (feels so good!)
- **`unmark <index>`** üîÑ - Oops, need to unmark? No problem!
- **`delete <index>`** üóëÔ∏è - Remove a task you don't need anymore
- **`priority <level>`** „ÄΩÔ∏è - Retrieve tasks with certain priority (1 highest, 3 lowest)
- **`bye`** üëã - Say goodbye to Doraemon (he'll remember everything!)
When you first open the app, Doraemon will greet you with:
> *"Hi I am Doraemon, your personal schedule assistant! Welcome to tell me anything!"*
- **[E]** üìÖ - Event tasks (with start and end dates!)
- üåà **Beautiful Gradients**: Soft blue-to-green backgrounds that are easy on the eyes
- üí¨ **Chat Style**: Messages in cute colorful bubbles
- üì± **Responsive**: Works great when you resize the window
- üîÑ **Auto-Scroll**: Always shows the latest messages automatically
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Doraemon.java      # The brain of the operation üß†
- üß™ **JUnit 5** - Testing to make sure it works perfectly
This is a project for a software engineering course! üìö
Inspired by the amazing Doraemon from the classic Japanese manga and anime! ü§ñ‚ú®
Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è and lots of ‚òï by someone who loves staying organized!

Welcome to Doraemon! Your friendly personal schedule assistant! üéØ
1. Run the application (use `./gradlew run` or run `Main.java`)
2. Type commands in the text field at the bottom
- **`hi`** üìã - Show all commands and how to use them
- ** `priority 1`** - Retrieve tasks that have the highest priority
- ** `priority 2`** - Retrieve tasks that have medium priority
- ** `priority 3`** - Retrieve tasks that have the lowest priority
- Use `list` to see all tasks and their numbers
- Commands work in any case (LIST, list, List)

* Parses a deadline command and creates an AddCommand with a Deadline task.
* Format: "description / date / priority" or "description / date" (defaults to priority 2)

* @return An AddCommand containing the deadline task
* @throws DoraemonException If the format is invalid

// Old style: third part is explicit priority "description / date / priority"
throw new DoraemonException("Priority must be 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Invalid priority format. Use 1, 2, or 3");
// New style: priority in square brackets after date, e.g. "description / 2025-02-22 [1]"
throw new DoraemonException("Priority must be 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Invalid priority format. Use 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Please specify a priority using [1], [2], or [3].");

* Parses an event command and creates an AddCommand with an Event task.

* @throws DoraemonException If the format is invalid
private static Command parseEventCommand(String arguments) throws DoraemonException {
throw new DoraemonException("Event format: description / from start / to end [/ priority]");
// Old style: fourth part is explicit priority "description / start / end / priority"
throw new DoraemonException("Priority must be 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Invalid priority format. Use 1, 2, or 3");
// New style: priority in square brackets after end date, e.g. "description / start / end [1]"
throw new DoraemonException("Priority must be 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Invalid priority format. Use 1, 2, or 3");
throw new DoraemonException("Please specify a priority using [1], [2], or [3].");

* Creates a ToDo task from parsed parts.

assert parts.length >= 5 : "Event line must have at least 5 parts";

* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
